Exercise 2.3-4

We can express insertion sort as a recursive procedure as follows. In order to sort , we recursively sort and then insert into the sorted array . Write a recurrence for the worst-case running time of this recursive version of insertion sort.

Our division of the problem yields 1 subproblem of size . Dividing the problem takes constant time, whereas solving it in the worst case takes time. Using our recurrence calculation (pg.35):
